title: Verify: Logged in Xbox Live account is required to access app content
custom_steps:
1. Select the MLB.TV app tile (in Apps section on Xbox dashboard) 
-App launches-
custom_expected:
The user will receive an access gate (Xbox Live Sign In prompt screen displays) 
AND we will be unable to continue without first logging in to Xbox Live. SELECT "Sign In" button opens the external MS Xbox Live Sign in app/menu.

title: Verify: Logging in to Xbox Live account at Sign In prompt, then allows access to app content
custom_steps:
1. Select the MLB.TV app tile (in Apps section on Xbox dashboard) 
-App launch & Xbox Live Sign in prompt displays- 
2. Select Sign in 
-the external MS Xbox Live Sign in app/menu opens- 
3. Sign in with (*valid) Xbox Live user account 
4. Attempt to access MLB app tile (UWP app does not require direct launch to app after sign-in, unfortunately)
custom_expected: App proceeds to launch.

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt in newsletter
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address 
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number 
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page 
AND the user's email account is set to receive the newsletter To confirm this, user must send opted-in email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been tagged with opt-in group â€œ428â€￾. -- Example: Hi DB Admin, Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters? For the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group â€œ428â€￾ and that the other did not. camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help. [Your Name]

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt out of newsletter

WHEN we enter an email address 
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number 
AND confirm password

AND advances to the In-Game alerts page 
AND the user's email account does not show an opt-in to receive the newsletter To confirm this, user must send the email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been NOT tagged with opt-in group â€œ428â€￾ (which may be an invalid group but out of scope for client-side testing) -- Example: Hi DB Admin, Can you please help me verify that an account created by our tvOS MLB.tv app has successfully opted in to receive MLB.com Newsletters? Though there is an open issue about this group code, for the purposes of this test I am checking to make sure that one user successfully opted into opt-in group â€œ428â€￾ and that the other did not. camlbtest@qsss.com - opt in cdsf33@mlbtest.com - no opt in Please let me know if you need any more information, and thanks in advance for the help. [Your Name]

title: ***Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity (using Network Link Conditioner) 
> EX: 
> sudo ipfw add 1 pipe 1 src-port 80 
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 3000KByte/s 
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 500KByte/s 
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 75KByte/s 
> sudo ipfw delete 1
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the bitrate adapt 
AND the video playback will adjust accordingly based on the connectivity of the wireless ad hoc network

title: ***Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
custom_steps:
WHEN we begin playback 
AND we slowly increase the available connectivity speeds
custom_expected: THEN the video quality will improve to a higher bitrate as the connectivity improves

title: ***Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity using Network Link Conditioner for our Ad Hoc Network to lower the connectivity speeds 
AND we throttle the network connectivity to increase the connectivity speeds
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the quality of the video adjusts in both directions in correlation with the connectivity speed 

Note: XB1 has a cache of about 30 seconds of video, so if internet connection is downgraded, lost, restored, there is a 30 second delay between the update in status and the video playback reflecting the change.
